decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The replacement wrought iron railings for the site frontage as shown on the submitted proposal drawings shall be as a closest match as possible in terms of materials specification and appearance to those original frontage railings which exist for No.69 Lauriston Road within the same building terrace.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON:&nbsp; In the interests of consistency and visual amenity and to preserve the appearance and character of the Victoria Park Conservation Area within which the site is situated.</p>

The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

<p>Prior to commencement of development, a planting scheme shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval which shall show planting details for the proposed stepped retaining wall planter beds.&nbsp; The plant specification shall contain a variety of plant species which are biodiversity rich in nature to provide a biodiversity uplift for the site.</p><p>The approved planting scheme shall be carried out within the first planting season following completion of the development or within any alternative phase(s) as may be agreed with the local planning authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON:&nbsp; In the interests of visual amenity and encouragement of biodiversity.</p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:12pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">No demolition, site clearance, or building operations shall commence on site until protective fencing to existing affected trees on site have been installed. Such fencing and protection measures shall be retained at all times until the completion of the development. Within all fenced areas, soil levels shall remain unaltered and the land kept free of vehicles, plant, materials, and debris.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e84438d6-7fff-7760-1385-68ee757e7d24"><br><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Reason:</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"> To protect the trees on site which are to be retained in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality. </span></span></p>
description: Replacement of existing boundary fencing adjacent to public footpath, modification of ground levels to the front garden and addition of an external door at lower ground floor level.
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
